text: Sir Alan William Parker, (14 February 1944 - 31 July 2020) was a British movie director from Islington, London. One of his best known movies is Bugsy Malone (1975). ==Early years== Parker was born into a working-class family in Islington, North London, the son of Elsie Ellen, a dressmaker, and William Leslie Parker, a house painter. ==Death== Parker died in London on 31 July 2020 at age 76. ==Filmography== * Melody (1971) (writer only) * Our Cissy (1974) (short film) * Footsteps (1974) (short film) * The Evacuees (TV, 1975) * Bugsy Malone (1976) * Midnight Express (1978) * Fame (1980) * Shoot the Moon (1982) * Pink Floydâ€”The Wall (1982) * Birdy (1984) * Angel Heart (1987) * Mississippi Burning (1988) * Come See the Paradise (1990) * The Commitments (1991) * The Road to Wellville (1994) * Evita (1996) * Angela's Ashes (1999) * The Life of David Gale (2003) ==References== ==Other websites== * * Official Alan Parker Website Category:1944 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in London Category:Academy Award winning directors Category:BAFTA Award winning directors Category:BAFTA Award winning writers Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire Category:Movie directors from London Category:Movie producers from London Category:People from Islington Category:Screenwriters from London
title: Alan Parker
